meanings.definition: To exert force on (someone or something) in order to move them away from oneself.
meanings.sent1: She pushes the swing to make it go higher.
meanings.sent2: He pushes the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pushes his toy car around the living room.
meanings.sent4: The wind pushes the clouds across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The river pushes the boat downstream with great force.

meanings.definition: To promote the development or progress of (something) by exerting force or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The teacher pushes her students to do their best in school.
meanings.sent2: The coach pushes the team to work harder during practice.
meanings.sent3: The gardener pushes the seeds into the soil to help them grow.
meanings.sent4: The sun pushes the flowers to bloom in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The music pushes the dancer to move with energy and passion.

meanings.definition: A forceful action or movement designed to achieve a particular result.
meanings.sent1: The final push to the finish line secured her victory.
meanings.sent2: The push to raise funds for charity was successful.
meanings.sent3: The playful push from her friend made her stumble and laugh.
meanings.sent4: The push of the button activated the alarm system.
meanings.sent5: The strong push of the wind knocked over the trash cans.
